sub_title: Strategy Lead | Marketing, Business Development, Sustainability in Commodity Value Chains &  International Trade
summary:
As a creator, strategist and business developer, I've been working in commercial and development roles in multiple industries and diverse environments, managing multidisciplinary & multicultural teams.  I focus on creating shared value and realising positive impact by developing new business concepts & models and establishing long-term partnerships.  I believe in the power of collaboration and joint storytelling to realise positive change.

My key interests are international commodity trade, sustainability and innovation.

profile_positions.description:
Palm Done Right is our production model and our positioning in our markets, linking what we do to the core issues in the sector.  I’ve defined that Palm Done Right stands for:
● 100% Organic
●  Fully Traceable
● Deforestation-Free
● Wildlife Friendly
● Fair & Social

My role at Natural Habitats is to develop, position and execute Palm Done Right in collaboration with supply chain partners up- and downstream. 

I create concepts, campaigns, impact reporting and engage our teams around our Palm Done Right Manifesto & Principles.

As the Palm Done Right spokesperson I share our story at trade fairs, through webinars, by writing articles and giving interviews.
profile_positions.title: Sustainability & Corporate Communication Director (May 2018 - present)

profile_positions.description:
After an in-depth internal GAP-analysis I worked with the Natural Habitats management team to review and strengthen company vision, mission and principes.  This provided the basis for writing the Palm Done Right Manifesto, the core document for delivering upon our mission to do palm right.  

To align all teams around Palm Done Right I developed & delivered internal team trainings to the Dutch, American and the Ecuadorian teams to internalise the Manifesto.
Once the mission was firmly implanted internally, we moved to the next level, engaging our external stakeholders around the Palm Done Right message.  We created a campaign and movement, bringing together farmers, processors, distributors, businesses, brands, retailers, consumers and media.
profile_positions.title: Corporate Strategy Consultant (October 2016 - May 2018)

profile_positions.description:
Co-developed a 3-day workshop "Private Sector Engagement" for French speaking African affiliates and their partners in Casablanca,  Morocco.

We developed the training for the African Oxfam affiliates around the new international policy for private sector collaboration, as a way to improve livelihoods for farmers and their communities in local production of commodities and food.

With the local Oxfam teams we explored what the new policy meant and what opportunities the new policy provided in their collaboration with local and international private sector players.
profile_positions.title: Workshop Developer and Trainer Private Sector Engagement (April - June 2018)

profile_positions.description:
The ‘FAIR Company-Community Partnership’ model has been developed by Oxfam as an approach to improve the social, environmental and economic sustainability of commodity production and trade.  

The objective of the partnership model is to contribute to a transition in the palm oil sector to drive the production and sourcing of responsibly grown palm oil, away from current unsustainable practices, both within and beyond the RSPO context. 

Focus lies on sustainable land use planning, smallholder development and creating long term mutually benefitting company-community partnerships
profile_positions.title: About FAIR Company-Community Partnerships

profile_positions.location: The Hague Area, Netherlands; Kinshasa, DRC
profile_positions.description:
Program development and private sector engagement for FAIR Company-Community Partnerships in the palm oil value chain.  The objective was to get business and communities in the palm oil sector to work together in a mutually benefitting collaboration.

I was co-writer of a winning proposal for the grant of The David and Lucile Packard Foundation.  Grant was used to engage the business around the FAIR Company-Community Partnerships model.

I organised the Co-Creation Day bringing together 50 stakeholders, including Tesco, Ahold, Henkel, Kao, L’Oreal, Ferrero, to design the way forward in the FAIR Company-Community Partnerships model and forge partnerships.  It created awareness for the next steps forward to increase local collaboration in creating sustainable palm oil landscapes.

I organised two multi-stakeholder events in Kinshasa, DRC, in collaboration with WNF and Proforest, with a direct link to the Tropical Forest Alliance 2020 agenda: https://www.tfa2020.org.  Bringing together stakeholders from the Congolese palm oil sector. We reached a consensus on the national principles for making the Congolese palm oil sector environmentally and socially sustainable, to be integrated in the national policies around palm oil.
profile_positions.title: Advisor Programme Development & Private Sector Engagement (Feb 2015 - Oct 2016)

profile_positions.description:
After working for UTZ Certified for three years, I wanted to gain more insights into what needs to happen in the producing countries to step up sustainable production, and into the local challenges and bottlenecks that exist to make structural improvements a reality.

PROJECTS
Oxfam Novib: organised workshop "Private Sector Engagement" for French speaking African affiliates and their partners. (Morocco)

Natural Habitats Group: developed Palm Done Right Manifesto & Principles; external stakeholder engagement palm oil sector. (NL; Ecuador)

Adam Smith International: conducted perception analysis of East-Congolese coffee sector with international traders & roasters, and delivered marketing action plan for the promotion of Congolese coffee. (Global; DRC)

Oxfam Novib: program development and private sector engagement for FAIR Company-Community Partnerships in the palm oil value chain. (Global; DRC)

Fair Match Support: led cocoa and nuts supply chain sustainability certification projects. (Sierra Leone; Central Asia)

UTZ Certified: developed awareness raising plan to facilitate uptake of UTZ program in India; reviewed repositioning with stakeholders, incl. action plan. (NL; India)

MVO Nederland: developed a communication strategy for the international CSR-program. (NL)

Lifemate Coffee: advised on sales strategy; established direct trade contacts with European traders & roasters. (Rwanda)
profile_positions.title: Independent Consultant Commodity Value Chains

profile_positions.description:
After living abroad for 4 years, I wanted to shift from a pure commercial role to a role at the intersection of business and sustainability.  I started in a new sector, commodity supply chain certification. With a small team in a fast growing organisation we focused on sustainable agricultural commodity production, focused on the coffee, cocoa and tea value chains.

I expanded and professionalised the marketing & communication department and managed a team of seven professionals, resulting in improved service and support to our customers.

I initiated and led the global repositioning and rebranding of UTZ Certified, from vision to implementation, strengthening the UTZ Certified brand.

I developed and implemented the new marketing and communication strategy resulting in increased awareness, visibility and market uptake of the UTZ program.

By collaborating with UTZ industry and NGO partners the team co-created consumer, customer and employee engagement concepts and programs globally.

The team initiated and led the global customer & partner support program.
profile_positions.title: Head Marketing & Communication Commodity Sustainability Standard

profile_positions.description:
Relocated to Poland and touched base with the commercial sector doing category management projects for Philips Polska and an assignment for POS Media Solutions.

It was also time to explore new avenues.  I started writing and invested time to master the Polish language. While learning the language I explored the fascinating history, culture and nature of Poland writing articles for a Dutch magazine.
profile_positions.title: Freelance Project Manager

profile_positions.description: Moving to India, welcoming the adventure, I devoted time to professional and personal development by doing a study program at INSEAD and by doing volunteer work assisting children from nearby slums in preparing for a prospectful future.
profile_positions.title: Volunteer

profile_positions.description:
Taking on a broader role I joined an innovative Israel-based company.  I focused on developing the novel category of plant-based meat replacement products, growing the business and professionalizing the strategic collaboration with leading Dutch and Belgium Ahold and Delhaize.  On top of the commercial objectives I was responsible for product development, logistics and quality management. It was great to work with a company that understood how to created share value for its business, its customers and consumers through innovation.

Achievements:
- Developed and implemented a new commercial strategy in the Benelux resulting in growth of brand sales and total category sales in the meat replacement category;
- Professionalized and managed trade relations with strategic retail partners Ahold and Delhaize.
- Directed new concept and product development resulting in successful launches.
- Optimised supply chain and quality control process.
profile_positions.title: Commercial Manager Benelux Tivall Plant-Based Foods

profile_positions.description:
Sara Lee | Douwe Egberts was known as best in class of marketing, category management and sales innovation.  Joined the company as I wanted to develop myself further professionally. Being part of the launch team of the innovative Senseo coffee system was a great experience. Enjoyed the collaboration between Douwe Egberts and Philips, as well as working in the interdisciplinary launch team internally.

Achievements:
- Realised successful trade introduction of the Senseo coffee concept at Dutch retail partners;
- Developed regional sales policy for coffee brands Van Nelle and Kanis & Gunnink.
profile_positions.title: Trade Development Manager Coffee Category
National Account Manager Dutch Retail Partners

profile_positions.description:
After a six weeks university research project in Vietnam I wanted to spend more time working in Vietnam, experiencing from within the transition it had embraced through its 'open door' politics Doi Moi.

Did a 4-month assignment for Friesland Dairy Foods, preparing the introductions of their Dutch Lady consumer products.

Did a 4-month assignment for SRG, a research agency, guiding market research for Unilever (qualitative and quantitative).
profile_positions.title: Marketing Intern

volunteer_experiences.description: Supported children in their basic school skills
